attributes.action: Encourage Japan to reverse their decision to resume commercial whaling on 1/7/19
attributes.additional_details:
Japanese demand for whale meat is so low that the major supermarkets have stopped selling whale meat.  Iceland and Norway are experiencing similar declines in demand. Pollution/climate change already negatively impacts the marine habitat.  Japan financially subsidises its whaling fleet.  There is no justification to resume the practice of whaling, either from a commercial, demand or ecological basis.

https://awionline.org/sites/default/files/press_release/files/AWI-IWC-report-final-2018.pdf
attributes.background: Japan has announced that it will resume commercial whaling from 1/7/19.  We petition the UK government to suspend the purchase of all Japanese products until the Japanese government can agree with the global wish to end the practice of commercial whaling.
